item.title: Juicero CEO Says Luxury Juicer Is 'Much More' Than Juice; Internet Is Unimpressed
item.description: April 21, 2017 - The company says its $400 machine cold-presses juice out of packets sold via subscription. Then a Bloomberg News video showed people didn't actually need the press to get juice from the packets.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 21, 2017 - The company says its $400 machine cold-presses juice out of packets sold via subscription. Then a Bloomberg News video showed people didn't actually need the press to get juice from the packets. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/04/21/525055713/juicero-ceo-says-luxury-juicer-is-much-more-than-juice-internet-is-unimpressed

item.title: Maurice Conti: Can Machines Think And Feel For Themselves?
item.description: April 21, 2017 - Futurist Maurice Conti says we've entered a new era where machines and humans partner to do what neither can do alone. He calls it the "Augmented Age."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 21, 2017 - Futurist Maurice Conti says we've entered a new era where machines and humans partner to do what neither can do alone. He calls it the "Augmented Age." http://www.npr.org/2017/04/21/524702119/maurice-conti-can-machines-think-and-feel-for-themselves

item.title: Marco Annunziata: What Will Human-Machine Collaboration Mean For Our Jobs?
item.description: April 21, 2017 - GE's Chief Economist Marco Annunziata is optimistic about "the marriage of minds and machines" — provided we manage it the right way.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 21, 2017 - GE's Chief Economist Marco Annunziata is optimistic about "the marriage of minds and machines" — provided we manage it the right way. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/21/524701908/marco-annunziata-what-will-human-machine-collaboration-mean-for-our-jobs

item.title: Erik Brynjolfsson: In A Race With Machines, Can We Keep Up?
item.description: April 21, 2017 - MIT Professor Erik Brynjolfsson sees a bright future where machines serve as powerful tools and partners. But he says we can only shape this future if we keep up with the pace of innovation.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 21, 2017 - MIT Professor Erik Brynjolfsson sees a bright future where machines serve as powerful tools and partners. But he says we can only shape this future if we keep up with the pace of innovation. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/21/524700928/erik-brynjolfsson-in-a-race-with-machines-can-we-keep-up

item.title: Jeremy Howard: Will Artificial Intelligence Be The Last Human Invention?
item.description: April 21, 2017 - Jeremy Howard has studied machine learning for 25 years. He says artificial intelligence can help achieve amazing things. But he warns the impact on jobs may cause a great deal of social instability.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 21, 2017 - Jeremy Howard has studied machine learning for 25 years. He says artificial intelligence can help achieve amazing things. But he warns the impact on jobs may cause a great deal of social instability. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/21/524702525/jeremy-howard-will-artificial-intelligence-be-the-last-human-invention

item.title: Yosemite Rangers Use Technology To Save Bears From Cars
item.description: April 20, 2017 - Speeding cars have become the biggest threat for bears in Yosemite. But rangers hope tracking tools, like the website where the public can track bears, will help keep both humans and bears safe.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 20, 2017 - Speeding cars have become the biggest threat for bears in Yosemite. But rangers hope tracking tools, like the website where the public can track bears, will help keep both humans and bears safe. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/04/20/524409047/yosemite-rangers-use-technology-to-save-bears-from-cars

item.title: President Trump's New Order Gives China Tech Opportunity To 'Hire American' Too
item.description: April 19, 2017 - The same week that President Trump issued his hire American executive order, the president of one of China's top tech companies said his company wants to do the same thing. Baidu's President Ya-Qin Zhang hit the Stanford University campus trying to recruit American computer science students.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 19, 2017 - The same week that President Trump issued his hire American executive order, the president of one of China's top tech companies said his company wants to do the same thing. Baidu's President Ya-Qin Zhang hit the Stanford University campus trying to recruit American computer science students. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/19/524751641/president-trumps-new-order-gives-china-tech-opportunity-to-hire-american-too

item.title: Car Design School Prepares For New Age Of Driverless Vehicles
item.description: April 19, 2017 - A car design school confronts the challenge of getting people to overcome their misgivings about driverless cars. Many Americans are not comfortable with self-driving cars, despite the fact that the industry is spending billions on the new technology.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 19, 2017 - A car design school confronts the challenge of getting people to overcome their misgivings about driverless cars. Many Americans are not comfortable with self-driving cars, despite the fact that the industry is spending billions on the new technology. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/19/524751571/car-design-school-prepares-for-new-age-of-driverless-vehicles

item.title: Malaysia Airlines Says It Will Use Satellites To Track Its Fleet
item.description: April 19, 2017 - Three years after MH Flight 370 disappeared from radar, Malaysia's national carrier says it will use satellites to track its planes at all times and that it will be the first airline to do so.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 19, 2017 - Three years after MH Flight 370 disappeared from radar, Malaysia's national carrier says it will use satellites to track its planes at all times and that it will be the first airline to do so. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/04/19/524681431/malaysia-airlines-says-it-will-use-satellites-to-track-its-fleet

item.title: Facebook's New Grand Plan To Draw You In
item.description: April 19, 2017 - In quintessential Silicon Valley style, Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg unveils ambitious plans to bring users from 2-D news feeds to 3-D imaginary worlds and neglects safety concerns.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 19, 2017 - In quintessential Silicon Valley style, Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg unveils ambitious plans to bring users from 2-D news feeds to 3-D imaginary worlds and neglects safety concerns. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/04/19/524643659/facebooks-new-grand-plan-to-draw-you-in

item.title: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg Addresses Cleveland Murder
item.description: April 18, 2017 - Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg gave his condolences to the family of a man murdered in Cleveland on Sunday, whose attacker shared videos of the killing on the social network.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 18, 2017 - Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg gave his condolences to the family of a man murdered in Cleveland on Sunday, whose attacker shared videos of the killing on the social network. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/18/524569206/facebook-ceo-mark-zuckerberg-addresses-cleveland-murder

item.title: Trump's Latest Executive Order Targets High Skilled Worker Visa Program
item.description: April 18, 2017 - President Trump announced an executive order on Tuesday that will sharpen the focus on the H1-B visa program. The tech industry is a key beneficiary and hopes this will prod Congress to overhaul the program.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 18, 2017 - President Trump announced an executive order on Tuesday that will sharpen the focus on the H1-B visa program. The tech industry is a key beneficiary and hopes this will prod Congress to overhaul the program. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/18/524569185/trumps-latest-executive-order-targets-high-skilled-worker-visa-program

item.title: WATCH: NASA Livestreams 360-Degree View Of Rocket Launch
item.description: April 18, 2017 - A special 360-degree camera was installed on the launch pad near the base of the Atlas V rocket heading to the International Space Station.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 18, 2017 - A special 360-degree camera was installed on the launch pad near the base of the Atlas V rocket heading to the International Space Station. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/04/18/524508253/watch-live-nasa-livestreams-360-degree-view-of-rocket-launch

item.title: Tech Is Dominating Efforts To Educate Syrian Refugees
item.description: April 18, 2017 - Half of private donors to Syrian students are funding educational technology, a report says. It's not necessarily what schools need, one co-author says, considering they may lack reliable electricity.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 18, 2017 - Half of private donors to Syrian students are funding educational technology, a report says. It's not necessarily what schools need, one co-author says, considering they may lack reliable electricity. http://www.npr.org/sections/ed/2017/04/18/523611124/tech-is-dominating-efforts-to-educate-syrian-refugees

item.title: Facebook Cracks Down On 30,000 Fake Accounts In France
item.description: April 17, 2017 - Facebook is targeting 30,000 fake accounts linked to France that are being used to spread fake news, spam, hoaxes and misinformation. The company said it is trying to "reduce the spread of material generated through inauthentic activity, including spam, misinformation, or other deceptive content that is often shared by creators of fake accounts."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
